Description: Ostracon, large section (three fragments joined) of the body of a pale-red pottery wine-jar, the fabric is light-brown in section and contains many small white inclusions, the body is globular and one handle survive, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of at least two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as year 8 wine of the Aten domain, head vintner being Hatiay.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393524) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393524)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Domain of Aten
